articles.title: Introduction to R for the Statistical Programmer
articles.description: A two hour workshop to get you started using R for all your clinical trial analyses
articles.contents:
What Youâ€™ll Learn
In this workshop, statistical programmers will be introduced to the R programming language and the tidyverse, using familiar clinical examples. Attendees will leave with a basic understanding of what R is, what the tidyverse is and why itâ€™s important, and what the open-source landscape has to offer us in the world of clinical statistical programming.
 All workshop materials can be found here 
Hands-on programming examples will be offered to give attendees some basic knowledge of the tools available in R to support common clinical workflows, such as SDTM, ADaM and clinical TFLs. If youâ€™ve never worked in R before, but want to see how it can be used in your day-to-day tasks, come join us and see what this powerful open-source language has to offer!
Instructors


Mike Stackhouse  Cheif Innovation Officer


Eli Miller  Cloud Solutions Architect




Nathan Kosiba  Software Developer


Maya Gans  Data Visualization Engineer


Phil Bowsher  Director of Life Sciences & Healthcare at RStudio, Inc

articles.title: Resources
articles.contents:
Function References
Function
Purpose
Docs
select
Selects variables in a data frame
ðŸ“„
filter
Subsets a data frame, retaining all rows that satisfy your conditions
ðŸ“„
rename
Changes the names of individual variables
ðŸ“„
arrange
Orders the rows of a data frame by the values of selected columns
ðŸ“„
bind_rows
Binds many data frames into one
ðŸ“„
*_join
Joins add columns from y to x, matching rows based on the keys
ðŸ“„
mutate
Adds new variables and preserves existing ones
ðŸ“„
if_else
Returns a value with the same shape as test which is filled with elements selected from either yes or no depending on whether the element of test is TRUE or FALSE
ðŸ“„
case_when
Allows you to vectorise multiple if_else() statements
ðŸ“„
rowwise
Allows you to compute on a data frame a row-at-a-time
ðŸ“„
summarize
Creates a new data frame. It will have one (or more) rows for each combination of grouping variables; if there are no grouping variables, the output will have a single row summarising all observations in the input. It will contain one column for each grouping variable and one column for each of the summary statistics that you have specified.
ðŸ“„
group_by
Takes an existing tbl and converts it into a grouped tbl where operations are performed â€œby groupâ€
ðŸ“„
count
Lets you quickly count the unique values of one or more variables
ðŸ“„
Where to Go From Here:
We mentioned a lot of amazing packages within the R ecosystem that we leverage every day. click on the package photo for more info and documentation

articles.title: Setup Your Environment
articles.description: We will spend most of our time in this workshop in RStudio Cloud. We recommend the Firefox or Chrome browsers and will use Firefox during the workshop.
articles.contents:
The Cloud
During the workshop we will be using RStudio Cloud. The benefit of this is we can all use R with the same configurations, rather than setting up R on each operating system.
You can find the project associated with the workshop here: https://rstudio.cloud/project/2623930. Once logged in, you should see the Phuse_intro_to_R_2021 project:

Clicking on the project will open an RStudio Session. This is what we will be using to program for the entirety of the course
